content:
Diagnosis:
Perihilar cholangiocarcinoma, stage IIIA (T4N1M0), ERBB2/3 co-amplified

Previous treatment:
Neoadjuvant gemcitabine-cisplatin March-July 2024
Radical bile duct resection with hepaticojejunostomy 15 August 2024

Current treatment:
Trastuzumab-deruxtecan trial therapy

Current situation:
Pre-cycle 3 assessment

Investigations:
CT 12 October 2024 - No evidence of recurrence
CA19-9 trending down from 245 to 89
LFTs stable - bilirubin 28, ALT 45, ALP 225

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 3 of trastuzumab-deruxtecan trial therapy. The second cycle was better tolerated than the first, with improvement in the grade 2 fatigue previously reported. Performance status remains 1. The mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers has not worsened. Blood tests show stable liver function and improving tumor markers.

On examination, surgical wounds are well healed. No evidence of disease recurrence. Weight stable at 72kg.

Plan:
1. Proceed with cycle 3 trastuzumab-deruxtecan today
2. Continue monthly CA19-9 monitoring
3. Next CT scan due after cycle 4
4. Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
5. Trial-specific quality of life questionnaires completed today
